H0.text: what did martha graham train as. Dancer

H1.text: what did martha graham train as. Choreographer

H2.text: what did martha graham train as. Actress

H3.text: what did martha graham train as. Screenwriter

A4.text: She danced and taught for over seventy years.

A5.text: Martha Graham was an American modern dancer, teacher and choreographer.

A6.text: She danced with her future husband, Erick Hawkins, in the movement entitled ‘Puritan Episode’.

A7.text: In 1930, she choreographed 'Lamentation', a piece in which the dancer's expressed emotion is aided by the Graham's choice in fabric.

A8.text: She became a student at the Denishawn school in 1916.

A9.text: She developed her own dance technique, Graham technique, that hinged on concepts of contraction and release.

A10.text: Balanchine and Ashton, along with Martha Graham, Leonide Massine, Jerome Robbins and others also created representational works.
